attributes.action: Make the use of single-use black plastic for food packaging illegal by 2020
attributes.background: Black plastic is widely used in food packaging and it cannot be recycled in most places.  There are viable alternatives readily available.

attributes.action: Stop the Oxford-Cambridge Expressway & all associated ill-conceived development
attributes.background: Disastrous plans for an expressway and 1,000,000 new homes across our Home Counties cannot be allowed to happen. How can Oxfordshire absorb double the amount of houses it currently has?  Similar proposals exist for Buckinghamshire, Bedfordshire, and Cambridge.  Totally unsustainable project.
attributes.additional_details: Guardian newspaper article and other media refers - https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/aug/22/project-britain-debate-oxford-cambridge-expressway

attributes.action: Ban sale of Rawhide dog treats, can be dangerous to the dogs health
attributes.background: Chews are made from cattle or horse hides, their journey starts with the hides sometimes being soaked in a toxic sodium sulphide to remove the hair/fat.
attributes.additional_details:
Chemicals can be used in order to split the hide into layers, they are often washed with hydrogen peroxide to give the white pure look and remove the rancid smell. 

Some chews have shown traces of arsenic, mercury, chromium and formaldehyde. They have been known to cause intestinal blockages, and there have been reported cases of poisoning from chemical residue and choking. The chews go slippery when wet and cause choking.

attributes.action: Disability Living Allowance indefinite awards should mean automatic PIP
attributes.background:
Claimants who still receive DLA indefinite awards are being requested that the claim is ending and they need to apply for PIP. 
Indefinite awards should mean that people can change over to PIP without having the assessments and all the paperwork 
Saving time money and stress
attributes.additional_details:
When we were awarded indefinite awards DLA claims we had to go through the assessments process and it all took time. 
DLA definite awards should mean that claimants should be able to change over to PIP without all the assessments 
Many disabled people are being denied PIP, Most of them have indefinite DLA awards 
Its not fair and discriminates people rights to claim and they have to appeal before the claims are getting through. 
Cut out all the waiting and assessments will save time and money.

attributes.action: Stop the 3.2% increase on rail fares set for 2019 after a disastrous 2018
attributes.background: The UK has some of the most expensive rail ticket prices in Europe. The catastrophic implementation of the 2020 plan show all train companies don't have a customer-centric approach and neglect users. Before raising prices, the government should put in place effective quality control system.

attributes.action: Increase statutory maternity pay to match other government pay amounts
attributes.background:
Becoming a parent can result in a significant reduction in income, causing many families to face cash flow problems. 

Many working parents are forced to return to work before a time which is best for their own mental health/the wellbeing of the child due to financial difficulties.
attributes.additional_details:
Statutory maternity pay is currently the lower of 90% of your weekly wage (pre-tax) or £145.18 per week. 
This is significantly lower than the state pension (£164.35 p/w)
This is lower than the benefits cap (£384.62 p/w).

Although becoming a parent is (for many) a choice, SMP is not sufficient to pay monthly bills and also provide for a child. This means many parents either delay or do not have children (and pregnancies are more high risk with older mothers), or are forced to return to work.

attributes.action: Protect hundreds of thousands of savers by preserving NS&I's use of the RPI
attributes.background: Reverse Treasury-backed NS&I's decision to switch the formula for increasing its index-linked savings certificate from the RPI to the CPI from May 2019 – and protect half a million pensioners' incomes.
attributes.additional_details:
Around 500,000 people hold NS&I's index-linked savings certificates. From May 2019 NS&I is switching its measure of inflation from the retail prices index to the consumer prices index.
This will lower the interest the certificates pay as CPI is usually lower. NS&I says the switch is in line with Government policy. Yet rail fares and student loans increase with RPI. The Government should honour the original terms of the certificates until such a time as taxpayer costs are also increased with CPI.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of wet wipes that have “flushable” on the packet.
attributes.background:
According the the BBC,“All wet wipes sold as flushable in the UK have failed the industrys disintergration test”. “Flushable” wet wipes cause 80% of blockages in sewers and cost around £100m a year.
This money could be reinvested into our ageing infrastructure and could prevent more ocean pollution

attributes.action: Impose legislation to stop charity bags being delivered to homes in the UK
attributes.background: charitybags.org.uk estimate that 525 million charity bags are delivered to homes in England & Wales per year – this would equate to 2,625 tonnes of plastic.
attributes.additional_details: They say only 3% are filled, meaning that a staggering 509 million bags may be ending up in landfill, contributing to the worldwide plastic problem.

attributes.action: Advanced Clinical Practitioners to be able to sign Med 3 forms (FIT notes)
attributes.background: Advanced Clinical Practitioners are heavily involved in patients medical treatments and investigations. They cover the short fall of medical staffing for the NHS. To help save time and efficiency they should be allowed by law to sign the FIT notes. Please reassess this situation.
attributes.additional_details: RCN

attributes.action: Establish penalties against companies for systematic late payment of invoices
attributes.background: Freelancers make up 15% of the UK workforce, yet there has been little change in legislation to support this shift. In particular the lack of appropriate legislation around payment terms gives freelancers little practical power to ensure terms are enforced - resulting in serious cash flow issues.
attributes.additional_details:
A small survey of freelancers (97 people) found that everyone had experienced late payment and 37.5% had to wait over 6 months to be paid - some people were never paid. Companies should simply not be allowed to operate like this.

Options currently available include taking a company to small claims court, which is costly & time consuming, and late payment fines which are an inadequate solution as again require the invoice to at some point be paid - and don't fix cash flow issues.

attributes.action: Stop all foreign aid and put the money saved into the NHS
attributes.background: The nhs is suffering from underfunding ,yet this goverment sends billions abroad in foreign aid time to put a stop to this now

attributes.action: Repeal the two child limit to Tax Credits and Universal Credit.
attributes.background:
It is a glaring injustice. It breaks the link between the assessment of children’s needs and the support they receive. 
It will worsen child poverty.  
Not all women have control over their reproductive destiny. Compulsory disclosure requirements will re-traumatise rape victims.
attributes.additional_details:
Many women will never disclose rape to anyone. Reasons include trauma, self-protection, shame, and fear for others - including their child. To force them to do so is cruel and risks danger.
There is already evidence that it is influencing decisions on pregnancy termination.
How could it be paid for?
The Government says the two child limit will save just over a £1bn in 2019/20. Since the policy was announced, OBR forecasts for spending on personal tax credits in 2019/20 have reduced by £2.2bn.

attributes.action: Establish a dedicated Select Committee on Climate Change.
attributes.background: The rise in atmospheric CO2 since pre-industrial times has caused the climate to warm and start potentially irreversible changes to the environment
attributes.additional_details:
Examples of what Parliament needs to be able to challenge: 
1. Encouragement of aviation by approving the 3rd runway at Heathrow, and failure to tax aviation fuel appropriately. 
2. Endorsing and funding road infrastructure instead of on-shore and offshore wind turbine projects. 
3. Withdrawing support for the Swansea Bay Tidal Project lagoon. 
4. Nursing the new fracking industry(which releases the more hazardous methane as well as CO2) in spite of the need to keep fossil fuels underground.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on England leaving the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: The Scottish have had the chance to vote for independence, it’s about time the English had the same right.

attributes.action: Establish a national day commemorating the significance of 15th August 1945.
attributes.background: Thousands of servicemen were held as Far East prisoners of war from 1941-1945, caught up in a conflict that endured long after the celebrations for VE Day. The contribution of those who had the misfortune to be held as pows, many of whom did not survive, deserves to be remembered nationally.
attributes.additional_details: Over 50,000 UK servicemen were held as Japanese prisoners of war in South East Asia between 1941-1945, of whom twenty-five per cent were either killed or died during captivity. With few survivors now left, this conflict is fast disappearing from living memory. These brave men felt cruelly overlooked upon their repatriation and beyond, and a national day of commemoration would go some way to putting that right.

attributes.action: Ban The Sale of Live Plucked Down Products In The United Kingdom.
attributes.background: China supplies 80% of the worlds down. Geese are forcefully restrained and feathers ripped out. This process is repeated every 6-7 weeks, causing birds considerable pain and distress. Many are left with gaping wounds, some even die.
attributes.additional_details:
Workers often sew the birds’ skin back together without anaesthetic.
Down is still widely used in the UK Fashion and Bedding Industries with most supplied by China. Make it compulsory law that retailers only supply down that meets the Responsible Down Standard (RDS) http://responsibledown.org/ and the DOWNPASS standard 2017 https://www.downpass.com/en/downpass/standard.html and ban the sale of all live-plucked down in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Move the target deadlines of the 2008 Climate Change Act from 2050 to 2035
attributes.background: The recent IPCC report on climate change, suggests that the process of climate change is accelerating, will have more dramatic effects and is more limited by time . This is grounds to amend the target or baseline year from 2050 to 2035 as outlined in the Climate Change Act; Section 2; Subsection 2.
attributes.additional_details:
The information is summarised in the IPCC report

https://www.ipcc.ch/pdf/session48/pr_181008_P48_spm_en.pdf

Popular press have reported it 
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/oct/08/global-warming-must-not-exceed-15c-warns-landmark-un-report

We need to consider how to reduce our dependency on fossil fuels for our long term future and that of the planet.  The Quaker testimony of stewardship compels me to have to take action at both a local and national level.

http://quaker.org/legacy/northbranch/stewardship.html

attributes.action: Block internet content on "how to commit suicide"
attributes.background: This issue needs addressing with a view to potentially reduce the risk of suicide. Suicide due to mental health is an increasing problem in many communities, not only my local one. I believe if the proposed action was taken, this would ban all cyber influential instructions on how to end your life.
attributes.additional_details: I'm sure somebody in every community has been affected by this growing problem which is very un-predictable. The un-predictability of suicide is what makes the issue so dangerous, with such glamourizing information on the internet if this is searched, it can be very influential to anybody suffering with mental health issues. Even young teenagers facing mental health issues may find this information and act on it.

attributes.action: Create a 26 week scan during pregnancy to reduce the risk of still births.
attributes.background: In 2016 There were 3,430 stillbirths throughout the year in the UK. still births are when the baby dies after 20 weeks. Could this figure be reduced if there was to be an extra scan that takes place at 26 weeks during pregnancy. In 2016 there were 9 stillbirths a day. That is 9 too many.

attributes.action: Amend DEFRA's guidelines on animal welfare. They condone "necessary" suffering.
attributes.background: If a case of alleged cruelty to farm animals reaches the courts the judiciary has to decide how much suffering is "necessary" and there is ample evidence to suggest that the benchmark is taken from what is current practice within the  farming industry at that particular time.
attributes.additional_details: Historically, cases have been brought to court where farm animals have clearly been subjected to suffering but if their suffering is deemed to be no more than is in keeping with standard practice at the time the case is brought, the animals' suffering is considered "necessary" and the case dismissed. The current guidelines refer to unnecessary suffering, so by implication, some suffering is necessary and to decide how much, the courts look to the very industry that causes the suffering. The word "unnecessary" needs to be omitted.

attributes.action: Make MP’s automatically lose their job if they are imprisoned.
attributes.background: It is wrong that MP’s can keep a position in government if they are sent to prison. If they are unable to attend parliamentary duties because of imprisonment they should be removed as an MP. MP’s should be setting an example and working to employment rules you would expect in the private sector.

attributes.action: Commons to vote on the question "Brexit is in the UK's best interest"
attributes.background: Despite the importance of this topic, there has never been a debate in the House of Commons specifically on this question. Parliament's first duty is to always act in what it considers to be the UK's best interest. Hence, that consideration needs to be made and should dictate action.
attributes.additional_details: Commons Briefing Paper 07212 of June 2016, regarding the EU Referendum, makes clear the status that the referendum result would have. Despite this, the result has been taken as a mandate for action. Parliament represents all UK citizens, whether they can and do vote or not, and should not facilitate a vote by c.26% of us as 'the will of the people' but act in what it judges the best interests of the UK and all its people. That judgement must be established.

attributes.action: Ban the use of commercial sunbeds and follow the lead of Australia.
attributes.background: Skin cancer rates continue to soar in the UK, melanoma kills 6 people per day. Experts in Australia say that rates have reduced since the ban. It is estimated by 2025 the treatment of skin cancers will cost the NHS £465m a year.The NHS is already overstretched. A ban would indirectly support our NHS
attributes.additional_details: If melanoma spreads through the body, it is notoriously difficult to treat. The treatments that are used are enormously expensive.The response to the previous petition failed to take into account findings by the World Health Organisation, Australia's model and relied on information which is 10 years out of date. CRUK say "Sunbed tanning is no safer than sun tanning" http://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/255695/9789241512596-eng.pdf;jsessionid=6F5B14C21F784CC479B1734435518C86?sequence=1

attributes.action: Ban the use of Larsen Traps which cause great suffering to corvids
attributes.background: A corvid, usually a crow or magpie is held captive in a small cage, which attracts other corvids who are then killed.  The bird's most vital instincts are denied, and neglect is rife. No one knows where the traps are and The Animal Welfare Act cannot be enforced.
attributes.additional_details:
Even smarter than humans!

The crows were able to carry out both tasks and to switch between them as appropriate. That demonstrates a high level of concentration and mental flexibility which few animal species can manage — and which is an effort even for humans.
The new findings were just published in the Journal Nature Communications.
Institute for Neurobiology, University of Tübingen




Corvids are on a par with the great Apes in terms of intelligence.
Regardless of any comparisons of various brain measurements, one can conclude that the similarities between corvids and great apes in complex cognitive skills also hold for at least one less taxing skill: motor self-regulation.

 Royal Society Open Science, 2016; 3 (4): 160104 DOI: 10.1098/rsos.160104

attributes.action: Provide free glasses on the NHS, for children with Irlens Syndrome.
attributes.background: Provide free glasses on the NHS, for children with Irlens Syndrome. This is not actually an optical problem but a problem with the way the brain processes visual information.
attributes.additional_details: They aren't available on the NHS as the prescription is a colour, not curved glass, leaving the parent to pay for a test to find the correct shade and depth of colour, the frame and the lenses, costing about £250+ plus regular assessments To read, write and reach their potential these children NEED their glasses but are penalised due to their prescription. Glasses for Irlens Syndrome are vital to their education and should be provided on the NHS just like any other children's glasses.

attributes.action: Exempt bows of stringed instruments from the Ivory Act registration requirement.
attributes.background: Musicians, music shops & auction houses are going to be severely affected by a new requirement to register bows of stringed instruments under the Ivory Act. The practicalities of doing so, along with the cost will make it very difficult – and in some cases impossible - to buy and sell antique bows.
attributes.additional_details: We fully support the ethics behind this act - endangered species and ecosystems must be protected. But these legitimate goals cannot be achieved by clamping down on antique instruments & bows. Musicians now face prosecution if they buy or sell a bow that doesn't conform to the expected registration. Many professional instrument bows will be left worthless and untradeable. This petition applauds the Ivory Act principles, but just asks for this one practicality to be changed for it to be workable.

attributes.action: Total ban on killing and eating of dogs and cats in uk
attributes.background: Total ban and new legislation to make the killing of cats and dogs for the purpose of food consumption illegal in the UK. The current law is that it is illegal to sell dog meat through licensed channels to the public, but actually eating dog and cat meat is not a specifically banned practice in UK.
attributes.additional_details: Daily mail article dated 6th August 2018

attributes.action: Fund more bobbies on the streets
attributes.background:
Street crime in our area is at its highest it’s ever been. 
Whether it be a mugging, theft, assault, burglary, drugs or intimidation of our children. 
Safe streets = safe children.
I’m sure you would have noticed that the number of on the beat police has dropped (or in some cases non-existent).
attributes.additional_details:
This in turn can breed a higher rate of ‘Street Crime’ and invites people into our area to commit offences. 
The more police presence we have on our streets will be a deterrent to these opportunistic criminals coming to our area and doing as they please. The police are understaffed and overworked, therefore can’t cope with the ever growing issues we are all bearing the brunt of. 
Low police presence = high crime rate 
High police presence = low crime rate

attributes.action: Ensure ALL records relating to the Chinook crash in 1994 are archived at Kew
attributes.background: The Chinook crash on the Mull of Kintyre, on 2 June 1994, resulted in the loss of 29 souls.  The pilots of the Chinook were wrongly blamed for the accident, resulting in a 17 year fight to clear their names. It was eventually proved that the MoD had wrongly blamed the deceased pilots.
attributes.additional_details: This 17 year miscarriage of justice brought about immense public support, several Parliamentary debates in both Houses, EDMs, reports from the National Audit Office and countless items of correspondence to, and from, the Ministry of Defence. Collectively, this is an important record of MoD, and RAF, failings and the loss of this would be detrimental to providing important learning opportunities for future military leaders.

attributes.action: Add the blood test for 22q to the Guthrie test 'heel prick' newborn screening.
attributes.background: My daughter has 22q11.2, she's historically been failed by clinicians, educational practitioners/institutions, social care and society in the wider context. Despite my concerns, late diagnosis at 4y6m, has impacted on her self esteem, language, social, emotional, mental health and life chances.
attributes.additional_details: Max Appeal is the UK charity that supports those affected. According to the All-Party Parliamentary Group, 22q11 could be the most common genetic disorder. 1 in 500 of the population has been reported, this would be 2x Down Syndrome, 6x Cystic Fibrosis. They found Mental health difficulties affect 93% of people with 22q11and it's the single most common cause of schizophrenia which affects 25% of people with 22q11. Delays in diagnosis has an adverse affect on the child, their family and it's also a hidden cost for the NHS, social services and welfare state.

attributes.action: Reverse the Cuts to Youth Services
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, demand the reversal of funding cuts to youth services since 2010 (62%). Youth work plays an integral role in the development of young people but is being jeopardised by the lack of support currently available. We must work to prevent youth violence and support mental health.
attributes.additional_details:
Research conducted by the YMCA found that overall spending on youth services in England has fallen by £737m (62%) since 2010. Between 2012 and 2016, 600 youth centres closed, 3,500 youth workers lost their jobs and 140,000 places for young people went. 

Unison (the union) asked youth workers about the impact of youth service cuts; 83% said they were having an effect on crime and antisocial behaviour, and 71% said it was now harder for young people to stay in formal education.

attributes.action: Tax on meat and dairy products to offset the damage caused in their production.
attributes.background: According to a news article published in late 2017 the global livestock industry causes 15% of all global greenhouse emissions, furthermore the over consumption of meat in the UK seriously damages health and is associated with hugely elevated heath care costs.
attributes.additional_details:
Excessive meat and dairy production damage both health and the environment. We call upon the government to tax their consumption along the lines of tobacco, alcohol and the burning of fossil fuels.

Research from the University of Oxford suggests surcharges of 40% on meat and 20% on milk would account for the damage their production causes, and reduce the impact of both emissions and unhealthy consumption. We ask the government to discuss the adoption of a tax at these levels.

attributes.action: Abolish the BBC television license.
attributes.background: The quality of BBC programmes do not reflect the price of the TV license. It is far too expensive for the majority of people and should be abolished.

attributes.action: Remove the ban on Tyler, The Creator entering the UK
attributes.background: Tyler The Creator was banned from the UK for controversial lyrics off his debut album Goblin in 2011. The content was clearly intended as adult humour, hasn't incited violence, and the artist has shown overwhelming growth since the record's release. As such, this ban feels petty and should be lifted

attributes.action: Ban cot bumpers and baby sleeping aids from being sold in the UK
attributes.background:
Every year babies die in cots where parents use bumpers and positional sleeping aids. These deaths are unnecessary and many are avoidable. 

The recommendations for safe sleep do not include these items and many parents are misinformed in the safety of these.

attributes.action: Amend the Official Secrets Act to prevent its use in cases of child abuse.
attributes.background: The Official Secrets Act may have deterred people from whistleblowing on paedophiles in positions of power. This is contrary to the public interest. We call on the Government to amend the Act to ensure that it can’t happen again.
attributes.additional_details:
There seem to have been moves to cover up cases of child abuse in order to protect people in power from accusations. This is evidenced by the Interview former chief whip Tim Fortescue gave to Panorama in 1995.
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/28207066/abuse-claims-senior-whip-would-help-colleagues
 
I have campaigned on this issue for 30+ years

attributes.action: We request a ban on issuing psychiatric drugs to children under 5 years old.
attributes.background: We strongly believe that the risk of potential harm from psychiatric drugs is too great to expose a young child’s brain to this risk. Countries like France have a ban until seven years of age. More research is needed in this field and caution is required until that point.
attributes.additional_details: We are aware that children as young as two could be being medicated with strong drugs designed for adult use, such as psychostimulants, antipsychotics or antidepressants. We have safeguarding concerns about this growing practice. Increasingly Educational Psychologists in the field are aware of such cases and this causes us great concern.

attributes.action: Do not put a UK hard border on the island of Ireland.
attributes.background: I ask the British government to commit to not carrying out checks on goods and people at the Irish border. To implement a hard border would risk reigniting conflict in the North of Ireland, putting those who live there at risk.

attributes.action: Invest in M25 J5 sliproads to improve Kent’s quality of life & lessen pollution
attributes.background:
West Kent is severely harmed by traffic passing through because of no M26 / A21 connectivity at M25 J5.
Slip roads would improve toxic air pollution,safety,quality of life and business growth.UK Govt Road Investment Strategy 20-25 includes J5 Slips but no guarantee of investment to see them built.

attributes.action: End Forced Academisation: Repeal Section 7 (Education and Adoption Act, 2016)
attributes.background: We call on the government to urgently issue an amendment to the Academies Act 2010 as updated by Section 7 from the Education and Adoption Act 2016, to remove the Secretary of State for Education’s power to issue ‘academy orders’ to schools which have been given an ‘inadequate’ Ofsted judgement.
attributes.additional_details:
The John Roan, Greenwich; Littlegreen Special School, Compton and Springfield Primary, Birmingham are facing forced academisation despite widespread opposition. 
 
Academisation has created fragmented provision, reduced accountability and democratic control, and the proliferation of obscene CEO salaries. Concerns about academisation include the exclusion of SEND children and the use of ‘off-rolling’ by MATs who seek to improve their position in the league tables; meaning children could be denied access to education. The law must change.

attributes.action: Lift the ban on .22 handguns.
attributes.background: I believe the original ban on handguns in the UK in the 1990s was undemocratic and disproportionate, then Tony Blair's government went further to ban .22 handguns for no good justifiable reason at all. I believe ownership of these firearms is not a concern for public safety, nor was it ever.
attributes.additional_details: We respectfully ask that these firearms be legalized again for personal ownership and sporting purposes.

attributes.action: The eligibility criteria for voting in UK/EU referenda must remain unchanged.
attributes.background: Those calling for a second EU referendum are also calling for the voting franchise to be extended to 16 and 17 year olds, resident EU nationals and all UK citizens resident overseas. This is a cynical move intended to influence the result towards "remain", should a second vote be held.
attributes.additional_details:
Voting in UK national referenda must continue to be restricted to those eligible to vote in a General Election, namely those who are:
Registered to vote, aged 18 or over on the day of the election (‘polling day’), British, Irish or qualifying Commonwealth citizens, resident at an address in the UK (or a British citizen living abroad who has been registered to vote in the UK in the last 15 years) and not legally excluded from voting.

attributes.action: End dog on dog attacks
attributes.background:
Currently there is no law to protect our dogs which is enforced, when a dog attacks or kills another dog. 
The government need to update the dangerous dogs act 1991 and make the owners liable for prosecution if an attack happens.
attributes.additional_details:
On the 19th August 2018 our blind 14yr old toy poodle was savagely attacked by two American bulldogs. She was playing in the long grass when the two dogs saw movement and hunted her. The dogs were too strong and she couldn’t be saved. 
We need to fight to save all other dogs lives from dangerous dogs which are not correctly restrained. 
We can’t bring Emma or the other dogs who have lost their lives back but we can try and change the future. 
#EmmasLaw

attributes.action: Childrens social workers to be mental health awareness trained and SEN trained
attributes.background:
Children are ending up in care wrongly, as front line social workers are not equipped with mental health awareness training or SEN trained. 
Reports on emotional harm are written wrongly, resulting children end up in care with complex needs and challenges that are not met until they leave care.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 Children and young people suffer with mental health issues. Though it still seems to be over looked in Childrens social work. They often lack  to correctly identify  a bullied child, a grieving child or child struggling at school because of SEN needs. Families are being split up because of lack of basic training that should be mandatory at University level with a yearly review in the work place.

attributes.action: Maternity hospitals to have separate buildings for parents of baby loss
attributes.background: Parents who are suffering baby loss whether it be miscarriage, still birth or ectopic, shouldn't have to go through the maternity hospital to get checked out or give birth. Many hospitals have separate wings but you're still in the maternity hospital which is full of babies, pregnancy and reminders.

attributes.action: HM Government must publish the legal advice on Brexit immediately
attributes.background: HM Government has received legal advice on its Brexit 'deal' but is refusing to make this public in spite of HM Opposition tabling a Humble Address on the matter. This is a very serious breach of parliamentary convention and cannot be allowed to go unchallenged.

attributes.action: Reopen the Woodhead Railway Line for Ro-Ro Trains to ease the A628 road.
attributes.background: The A628 road is dangerously congested daily, so an option to use RoRo trains between Stockport and Sheffield to take trucks off the Woodhead Pass, this would be economically viable to the transport industry, and reducing the Carbon Footprint Environment for the local communities along the A628.
attributes.additional_details: The A628 road is every day heavily congested, there is a planned project to utilise Roll on Roll off trains taking trucks off the Woodhead Pass, this would be a business cost saving on fuel wear & tare to the haulage industry, and reduce the Carbon Footprint improving the environment for the communities along the A628 route. Also reopening the line allows another cross Penine rail line to ease the pressure of the current Penine Rail routes.

attributes.action: Abolish the out dated 'ONE MILE RULE' in the dispensing of medication in England
attributes.background: A Dickensian rule was set in the early nineteen hundreds which states that Doctors prescribe and Apothecaries dispense. Doctors could only dispense if the patient lived more than a mile from the Apothecary (as the crow flies) due to Doctors staff not being qualified.
attributes.additional_details:
Now in the 21st century,Doctors dispensing staff are as qualified in all aspects of dispensing and services as the Chemists.The One Mile Rule should now be abolished to fit the NHS White Paper headed PATIENT CHOICE,so that ALL patients in practices throughout the country have the option to choose where they would like their medications dispensed be,it Retail,Online or Doctors Dispensaries.
Therefore by abolishing the ONE MILE RULE, the Government will adhere to the heading of the NHS White Paper

attributes.action: Standardise speed limits for vehicles up to 3500kg
attributes.background: Currently commercial vehicles including light weight vans are limited to 60mph on dual carrageways and 50 mph on single. This causes confusion and frustration for vehicles following.
attributes.additional_details: Not everyone is aware of this rule and probably wonder why vans are traveling slowly, holding up traffic, forcing following vehicles to overtake which can be hazardous. People who are unaware of the rule can find themselves with an unnecessary speeding ticket.
